線音源の干渉性/非干渉性が障壁の挿入損失に及ぼす影響
ソフトな円筒状エッジを持つ実物大防音壁の遮音性能
paper_title.en: Noise Shielding Efficiency of the Full-scale Barrier with a Cylinder-like Soft Obstacle at the Edge

description.ja: 近年の自動車交通量増加に伴い道路交通騒音は道路沿線の重要な環境問題となっている。この騒音レベルを環境基準以下に保つために採用されているものの一つに防音壁がある。防音壁の性質上, 大きな遮音性能を得ようとして単純な防音壁を用いれば非常に高さの高いものが要求される。現状では通常高速道路で8mにも及ぶものが延々と建設されているところもある。一方, この防音壁の高さは一定に保ちながら遮音性能を向上させる研究も多く行われ, その成果が吸音性円筒や複数エッジを持つ新型遮音壁として広く利用されている。著者らもその新型遮音壁の開発に取り組んでおり, 近年音響的にソフトな表面を持つ円筒状物体を防音壁のエッジに取り付けることで別の形式の新型遮音壁を公表してきた。今回そのソフトな形式の新型遮音壁の性能を実用化された実物大のものを用いて測定した。測定手法には従来から行われている帯域雑音を用いて挿入損失を計る方法と, 今回はインパルス応答を測定し, 挿入損失を計る方法をも用い, 合わせて二通りの手法で行った。両者によりソフトな円筒状物体を持つ新型遮音壁の遮音性能として比較的良好な結果が得られたのでここに報告する。
description.en: With the recent increases in traffic on the highways, the noise from vehicles has become a serious environmental problem along these routes. One of the measures taken to reduce the noise level less than the environmental standards is noise barriers. Due to the performance characteristics of noise barriers, a high noise shielding effect requires very high noise barriers. As a matter of fact, there are some cases where noise barriers are constructed as high as 8-m from the surface of the highway. On the other hand, various studies have been conducted to improve the shielding efficiency of noise barriers while maintaining the height at a fixed level. As a result, new noise shielding walls with absorptive cylindrical obstacles or multiple edges attached have been widely used. The authors of this paper have also worked on the development of these new types of noise barriers. We have recently developed another new type of noise barrier in which a cylindrical obstacle with an acoustically soft surface is attached to the top edge of a noise barrier. And we have now measured the performance or efficiency of the new type of soft surface noise barrier by means of a full-scale model. We have employed two methods to measure the sound shielding efficiency. One of them measures insertion loss by using band noise. The other method determines the insertion loss by measuring the impulse response. Comparatively favorable results were obtained as reported below.

publisher.ja: The Institute of Noise Control Engineering of Japan

paper_title.en: Influence of the directivity of a sound source on insertion loss of a noise barrier
A study on the new type noise barrier
Visualization of the sound field around a Schroeder diffuser

description.en: This paper presents an attempt to visualize the sound field near the surface and inside the wells of a Schroeder diffuser. The distribution of particle velocity in the sound field is analyzed numerically and compared with an experimentally measured distribution. To obtain the experimental distribution, Kundt's method is employed using a two-dimensional acoustic duct and fine cork powder. The predicted and measured distributions are qualitatively in good agreement. As an application of the results, a new sound absorbing structure is developed for the low frequency range. The absorption coefficient at normal incidence is 0.5 at 63 Hz and higher than 0.9 above 80 Hz. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Sound insulation efficiency of a building's window for diffracted sound
SNR<sub>slml</sub> an index of speech intelligibility for room acoustic design and its application
ON the effect of the bending vibration on the acoustic properties of thin poroelastic plates
Study on the insertion loss of a noise barrier for a directional sound source

description.en: In this study, the directivity of tire noise, the dominant noise source of a vehicle moving at a constant speed, was modeled in a two dimensional sound field. The performance of the barrier for different kinds of directivities was numerically calculated by the boundary element method (BEM). The results show that the insertion loss increases as the horizontal directivity becomes stronger and decreases as the vertical directivity becomes stronger.
